name: ISO/IEC 27001:2013
description: Information security management system (ISMS) requirements â€” Annex A controls

controls.title: Policies for information security
controls.description: A set of policies for information security shall be defined, approved by management, published and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.

controls.title: Review of policies for information security
controls.description: The policies for information security shall be reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

controls.title: Information security roles and responsibilities
controls.description: All information security responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.

controls.title: Segregation of duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse.

controls.title: Contact with authorities
controls.description: Appropriate contacts with relevant authorities shall be maintained.

controls.title: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: Appropriate contacts with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations shall be maintained.

controls.title: Information security in project management
controls.description: Information security shall be addressed in project management, regardless of the type of project.

controls.title: Mobile device policy
controls.description: A policy and supporting security measures shall be adopted to manage the risks introduced by using mobile devices.

controls.title: Teleworking
controls.description: A policy and supporting security measures shall be implemented to protect information accessed, processed or stored at teleworking sites.

domains.name: Human Resource Security
domains.description: Prior to, during, and termination/change of employment

controls.title: Screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates for employment shall be carried out in accordance with relevant laws, regulations and ethics.

controls.title: Terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: The contractual agreements with employees and contractors shall state their and the organization's responsibilities for information security.

controls.title: Management responsibilities
controls.description: Management shall require all employees and contractors to apply information security in accordance with the established policies and procedures.

controls.title: Information security awareness, education and training
controls.description: All employees and relevant contractors shall receive appropriate awareness education and training and regular updates in organizational policies and procedures.

controls.title: Disciplinary process
controls.description: There shall be a formal and communicated disciplinary process in place to take action against employees who have committed an information security breach.

controls.title: Termination or change of employment responsibilities
controls.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, communicated and enforced.

domains.name: Asset Management
domains.description: Responsibility for assets, information classification, media handling

controls.title: Inventory of assets
controls.description: Assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified and an inventory of these assets shall be drawn up and maintained.

controls.title: Ownership of assets
controls.description: Assets maintained in the inventory shall be owned.

controls.title: Acceptable use of assets
controls.description: Rules for the acceptable use of information and of assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified, documented and implemented.

controls.title: Return of assets
controls.description: All employees and external party users shall return all of the organizational assets in their possession upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

controls.title: Classification of information
controls.description: Information shall be classified in terms of legal requirements, value, criticality and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification.

controls.title: Labelling of information
controls.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme.

controls.title: Handling of assets
controls.description: Procedures for handling assets shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme.

controls.title: Management of removable media
controls.description: Procedures shall be implemented for the management of removable media in accordance with the classification scheme.

controls.title: Disposal of media
controls.description: Media shall be disposed of securely when no longer required, using formal procedures.

controls.title: Physical media transfer
controls.description: Media containing information shall be protected against unauthorized access, misuse or corruption during transportation.

domains.name: Access Control
domains.description: Business requirements, user access, system/application access

controls.title: Access control policy
controls.description: An access control policy shall be established, documented and reviewed based on business and information security requirements.

controls.title: Access to networks and network services
controls.description: Users shall only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.

controls.title: User registration and de-registration
controls.description: A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.

controls.title: User access provisioning
controls.description: A formal user access provisioning process shall be implemented to assign or revoke access rights for all user types to all systems and services.

controls.title: Management of privileged access rights
controls.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and controlled.

controls.title: Management of secret authentication information of users
controls.description: The allocation of secret authentication information shall be controlled through a formal management process.

controls.title: Review of user access rights
controls.description: Asset owners shall review users' access rights at regular intervals.

controls.title: Removal or adjustment of access rights
controls.description: The access rights of all employees and external party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.

controls.title: Use of secret authentication information
controls.description: Users shall be required to follow the organization's practices in the use of secret authentication information.

controls.title: Information access restriction
controls.description: Access to information and application system functions shall be restricted in accordance with the access control policy.

controls.title: Secure log-on procedures
controls.description: Where required by the access control policy, access to systems and applications shall be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.

controls.title: Password management system
controls.description: Password management systems shall be interactive and shall ensure quality passwords.

controls.title: Use of privileged utility programs
controls.description: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

controls.title: Access control to program source code
controls.description: Access to program source code shall be restricted.

controls.title: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls
controls.description: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information shall be developed and implemented.

controls.title: Key management
controls.description: A policy on the use, protection and lifetime of cryptographic keys shall be developed and implemented through their whole lifecycle.

controls.title: Physical security perimeter
controls.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain either sensitive or critical information and information processing facilities.

controls.title: Physical entry controls
controls.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

controls.title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
controls.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and applied.

controls.title: Protecting against external and environmental threats
controls.description: Physical protection against natural disasters, malicious attack or accidents shall be designed and applied.

controls.title: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Procedures for working in secure areas shall be designed and applied.

controls.title: Delivery and loading areas
controls.description: Access points such as delivery and loading areas and other points where unauthorized persons could enter the premises shall be controlled.

controls.title: Equipment siting and protection
controls.description: Equipment shall be sited and protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and opportunities for unauthorized access.

controls.title: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Equipment shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

controls.title: Cabling security
controls.description: Power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage.

controls.title: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Equipment shall be correctly maintained to ensure its continued availability and integrity.

controls.title: Removal of assets
controls.description: Equipment, information or software shall not be taken off-site without prior authorization.

controls.title: Security of equipment and assets off-premises
controls.description: Security shall be applied to off-site assets taking into account the different risks of working outside the organization's premises.

controls.title: Secure disposal or reuse of equipment
controls.description: All items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

controls.title: Unattended user equipment
controls.description: Users shall ensure that unattended equipment has appropriate protection.

controls.title: Clear desk and clear screen policy
controls.description: A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

domains.name: Operations Security
domains.description: Operational procedures, malware protection, backup, logging, software control, vulnerability management, audit

controls.title: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Operating procedures shall be documented and made available to all users who need them.

controls.title: Change management
controls.description: Changes to the organization, business processes, information processing facilities and systems that affect information security shall be controlled.

controls.title: Capacity management
controls.description: The use of resources shall be monitored, tuned and projections made of future capacity requirements to ensure the required system performance.

controls.title: Separation of development, testing and operational environments
controls.description: Development, testing, and operational environments shall be separated to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the operational environment.

controls.title: Controls against malware
controls.description: Detection, prevention and recovery controls to protect against malware shall be implemented, combined with appropriate user awareness.

controls.title: Information backup
controls.description: Backup copies of information, software and system images shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with an agreed backup policy.

controls.title: Event logging
controls.description: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, faults and information security events shall be produced, kept and regularly reviewed.

controls.title: Protection of log information
controls.description: Logging facilities and log information shall be protected against tampering and unauthorized access.

controls.title: Administrator and operator logs
controls.description: System administrator and system operator activities shall be logged and the logs protected and regularly reviewed.

controls.title: Clock synchronization
controls.description: The clocks of all relevant information processing systems within an organization or security domain shall be synchronized to a single reference time source.

controls.title: Installation of software on operational systems
controls.description: Procedures shall be implemented to control the installation of software on operational systems.

controls.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems being used shall be obtained in a timely fashion, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities evaluated and appropriate measures taken to address the associated risk.

controls.title: Restrictions on software installation
controls.description: Rules governing the installation of software by users shall be established and implemented.

controls.title: Information systems audit controls
controls.description: Audit requirements and activities involving verification of operational systems shall be carefully planned and agreed to minimize disruptions to business processes.

domains.name: Communications Security
domains.description: Network security management and information transfer

controls.title: Network controls
controls.description: Networks shall be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

controls.title: Security of network services
controls.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and management requirements of all network services shall be identified and included in network services agreements.

controls.title: Segregation in networks
controls.description: Groups of information services, users and information systems shall be segregated on networks.

controls.title: Information transfer policies and procedures
controls.description: Formal transfer policies, procedures and controls shall be in place to protect the transfer of information through the use of all types of communication facilities.

controls.title: Agreements on information transfer
controls.description: Agreements shall address the secure transfer of business information between the organization and external parties.

controls.title: Electronic messaging
controls.description: Information involved in electronic messaging shall be appropriately protected.

controls.title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Requirements for confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, regularly reviewed and documented.

controls.title: Information security requirements analysis and specification
controls.description: The information security related requirements shall be included in the requirements for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.

controls.title: Securing application services on public networks
controls.description: Information involved in application services passing over public networks shall be protected from fraudulent activity, contract dispute and unauthorized disclosure and modification.

controls.title: Protecting application services transactions
controls.description: Information involved in application service transactions shall be protected to prevent incomplete transmission, mis-routing, unauthorized message alteration, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized message duplication or replay.

controls.title: Secure development policy
controls.description: Rules for the development of software and systems shall be established and applied to developments within the organization.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: System change control procedures
controls.description: Changes to systems within the development lifecycle shall be controlled by the use of formal change control procedures.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Technical review of applications after operating platform changes
controls.description: When operating platforms are changed, business critical applications shall be reviewed and tested to ensure there is no adverse impact on organizational operations or security.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Restrictions on changes to software packages
controls.description: Modifications to software packages shall be discouraged, limited to necessary changes and all changes shall be strictly controlled.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Secure system engineering principles
controls.description: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system implementation efforts.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Secure development environment
controls.description: Organizations shall establish and appropriately protect secure development environments for system development and integration efforts that cover the entire system development lifecycle.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Outsourced development
controls.description: The organization shall supervise and monitor the activity of outsourced system development.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: System security testing
controls.description: Testing of security functionality shall be carried out during development.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: System acceptance testing
controls.description: Acceptance testing programs and related criteria shall be established for new information systems, upgrades and new versions.
controls.category: Security in Development and Support Processes

controls.title: Protection of test data
controls.description: Test data shall be selected carefully, protected and controlled.

domains.name: Supplier Relationships
domains.description: Information security in supplier relationships and service delivery management

controls.title: Information security policy for supplier relationships
controls.description: Information security requirements for mitigating the risks associated with supplier's access to the organization's assets shall be agreed with the supplier and documented.

controls.title: Addressing security within supplier agreements
controls.description: All relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier that may access, process, store, communicate, or provide IT infrastructure components for, the organization's information.

controls.title: Information and communication technology supply chain
controls.description: Agreements with suppliers shall include requirements to address the information security risks associated with information and communications technology services and product supply chain.

controls.title: Monitoring and review of supplier services
controls.description: Organizations shall regularly monitor, review and audit supplier service delivery.

controls.title: Managing changes to supplier services
controls.description: Changes to the provision of services by suppliers, including maintaining and improving existing information security policies, procedures and controls, shall be managed.

controls.title: Responsibilities and procedures
controls.description: Management responsibilities and procedures shall be established to ensure a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents.

controls.title: Reporting information security events
controls.description: Information security events shall be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible.

controls.title: Reporting information security weaknesses
controls.description: Employees and contractors using the organization's information systems and services shall be required to note and report any observed or suspected information security weaknesses in systems or services.

controls.title: Assessment of and decision on information security events
controls.description: Information security events shall be assessed and it shall be decided if they are to be classified as information security incidents.

controls.title: Response to information security incidents
controls.description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

controls.title: Learning from information security incidents
controls.description: Knowledge gained from analyzing and resolving information security incidents shall be used to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.

controls.title: Collection of evidence
controls.description: The organization shall define and apply procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of information, which can serve as evidence.

domains.name: Information Security Aspects of Business Continuity Management

controls.title: Planning information security continuity
controls.description: The organization shall determine its requirements for information security and the continuity of information security management in adverse situations.

controls.title: Implementing information security continuity
controls.description: The organization shall establish, document, implement and maintain processes, procedures and controls to ensure the required level of continuity for information security during an adverse situation.

controls.title: Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity
controls.description: The organization shall verify the established and implemented information security continuity controls at regular intervals in order to ensure that they are valid and effective during adverse situations.

controls.title: Availability of information processing facilities
controls.description: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.

domains.name: Compliance
domains.description: Compliance with legal/contractual requirements and information security reviews

controls.title: Identification of applicable legislation and contractual requirements
controls.description: All relevant legislative statutory, regulatory, contractual requirements and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be explicitly identified, documented and kept up to date.
controls.category: Compliance with Legal and Contractual Requirements

controls.title: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: Appropriate procedures shall be implemented to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory and contractual requirements related to intellectual property rights and use of proprietary software products.
controls.category: Compliance with Legal and Contractual Requirements

controls.title: Protection of records
controls.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.
controls.category: Compliance with Legal and Contractual Requirements

controls.title: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
controls.description: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information shall be ensured as required in relevant legislation and regulation where applicable.
controls.category: Compliance with Legal and Contractual Requirements

controls.title: Regulation of cryptographic controls
controls.description: Cryptographic controls shall be used in compliance with all relevant agreements, legislation and regulations.
controls.category: Compliance with Legal and Contractual Requirements

controls.title: Independent review of information security
controls.description: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals or when significant changes occur.

controls.title: Compliance with security policies and standards
controls.description: Managers shall regularly review the compliance of information processing and procedures within their area of responsibility with the appropriate security policies, standards and any other security requirements.

controls.title: Technical compliance review
controls.description: Information systems shall be regularly reviewed for compliance with the organization's information security policies and standards.
